meanings.definition: A member of a Tibetan people living on the high southern slopes of the Himalayas in eastern Nepal, known for their skill in mountaineering.
meanings.sent1: The sherpas are experts at climbing mountains.
meanings.sent2: Many sherpas help climbers reach the summit of Mount Everest.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sherpa bring a ladder to the mountain? To reach new heights!
meanings.sent4: The sherpas are like human mountain goats, effortlessly scaling the peaks.
meanings.sent5: The image of sherpas conquering the treacherous slopes is awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: A guide and porter in the Himalayas, especially one who assists climbers on Mount Everest.
meanings.sent1: The sherpa led the group safely through the mountain pass.
meanings.sent2: Experienced sherpas are crucial for successful expeditions on Everest.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sherpa carry a backpack full of rocks? To rock the mountain!
meanings.sent4: The sherpa's guidance was a beacon of hope in the harsh terrain.
meanings.sent5: The sherpa's presence was like a reassuring anchor amidst the icy winds.
